intro: Asyneuma argutum subsp. pavlovii, commonly known as the Pavlov's sandbur, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, spiny seed pods that aid in seed dispersal. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly habitats, showing adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it blooms during the summer months. Asyneuma argutum subsp. pavlovii is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
